gmd:otherCitationDetails.gco:CharacterString: A selection of model output fields are also available at the USGS Oceanographic Data and Model Portal, https://cmgdata.usgsportals.net .

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: The COAWST modeling system has been used to simulate ocean and wave processes along the of US East Coast and Gulf of Mexico using a 5km resolution domain. The model has been executed on a daily basis with hourly outputs saved since 2013. Users can access the model output data to analyze various physical fields such as water level, temperature, salinity, currents, wave heights, periods, directions, etc.

gmd:purpose.gco:CharacterString: The model domain was developed to simulate US-East Coast for analyzing physical fields such as temperature and salinity along the coast. The model output is also utilized to create forcing conditions to drive sub-domains for studying regional coastal response to storms or other natural phenomena.

gmd:credit.gco:CharacterString: This study was funded through the Carolinas Coastal Change and Processes Project, Coastal Model Applications and Field Measurements Project and the Cross-shore and Inlets Project, US Geological Survey Coastal Marine Hazards and Resources Program.

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: U.S. Geological Survey, Woods Hole Coastal and Marine Science Center

gmd:otherConstraints.gco:CharacterString: Please cite this as: Warner, J.C., and Kalra, T.S., 2021, Collection of COAWST model US East Coast simulations for forecasting purposes: U.S. Geological Survey data release, https://doi.org/FILL.

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: U.S. Geological Survey, Woods Hole Coastal and Marine Science Center

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: U.S. Geological Survey Coastal Marine Geology (CMG) Portal provides model and measurement data together with related geospatial data pertaining to USGS CMG Program activites.
The COAWST modeling system has been used to simulate ocean and wave processes along the US East Coast and Gulf of Mexico using a 5km resolution domain.

gmd:supplementalInformation.gco:CharacterString: The model has Arakawa C-grid type staggered grids for each of the following; grid cell centers, cell-edge mid-points, and corners. Grid cells are of irregular sizes but are rectangular with maximum orthogonality while conforming to the curvilinear shape of the grid. Generally, vector quantities such as velocity are calculated at cell edges, whereas the scalar quantities such as density are calculated at cell centers. Geospatial vertical resolution is variable due to the sigma coordinate system of the numerical model.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: Coupling input file for COAWST module: coupling_coawst.in
Input file for hydrodynamic module: ocean_coawst.in
Input file for hydrodynamic module: swan_coawst.in
Circulation model header file for selecting the model modules: coawst.h
Hydrodynamic model computational grid file: USEast_grd37.nc
Tidal forcing file: tide_forc_USeast_grd16_osu_rev2.nc
Forcing applied at the boundaries of the computational grid: USE_coawst_bdy.nc
Input climatological file: USE_coawst_clm.nc
>Input file for meteorological forcing(s) applied over the computational grid: Big_grd2_coawstwind.nc
>Initial conditions at the beginning of the simulation: Ocean_use_rst.nc
>Input for sediment transport module: sediment_coawst.in
